content: kodiak cowl by emily franck of the blue mouse page 1 materials full video tutorial yarn - dk weight #3 approx http //bit ly/kodiakcowl >> color a 55 yards 50 m ​ >> color b 55 yards 50 m abbreviations ​ yardage may vary if your gauge/yarn is - bobble = bind off different - brk1 = brioche knit 1 - brp1 = brioche purl 1 sample uses - ca/lt = color a/light color featherfin yarn cashmerino dk - cb/dk = color b/dark color ​ 80% sw merino 20% mongolian cashmere - co = cast on 270 yds 250 m per 100g in the colorways - k = knit k3 = knit 3 pale pistachio & pine - sl1yo = slip 1 yarn over - sts = stitches needles - p = purl p5 = purl 5 us 6 4 0 mm 16 40 cm circular needles or size needed to match gauge other materials yarn needle stitch marker sizing cowl length = 12 5 32 cm cowl circumference = 26 66 cm gauge 2 color brioche in the round after blocking 13 5 sts/27 rounds = 4 10 cm notes on gauge >> round gauge for this project is measured by counting the vertical column of vʼs of each color so 2 worked rounds = 1 gauge round >> round gauge is not as important as stitch gauge more free patterns craggy shore socks | ivy cardigan | glen echo baby blanket | sea oats socks ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ popular paid for patterns lofoten sweater | thun sweater | worsted lofoten | vale beanie | skorda cowl ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ 2019 copyright ©the blue mouse | emily franck kodiak cowl | @thebluemouse_ page 2 pattern block your project weave in your ends and enjoy using cb dark color very loosely co 88 sts place marker & join in the round note i like to co 89 stitches and do the invisible join in the round decreasing 1 stitch video tutorial for that here ​ ​ setup round cb *sl1yo p1 repeat from ​ * to the end note at the end of the round leave your yarn hanging in the front of your work round 1 ca *brk1 sl1yo repeat from * ​ to the end round 2 cb *sl1yo brp1 repeat from * ​ kodiak cowl to the end note for the last brp1 of the round make sure by emily franck of the blue mouse the yo from the previous round is still there if it isnʼt then just replace it with ca and finish with follow on instagram @thebluemouse_ the brp1 see video tutorial on page 1 if you re ​ subscribe & watch the podcast confused join our ravelry group repeat rounds 1 & 2 -- 83 more times each ​ ​ share your projects on ravelry or instagram ​ for a total of 166 more rounds using then work round 1 once
